comments.html:
I stand by my previous comment. Either the built-in redundancy works transparently, or it should not be there at all. Adding some brittle "works sometimes, perhaps, but be careful and don't rely on it" feature (or set of features) to increase reliability seems absurd to me. Just say no.

In the words of Edsger W. Dijkstra: "Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability."
comments.name: Erik Auerswald
